metadata.title: CVE-2020-24504 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Uncontrolled resource consumption in some Intel(R) Ethernet E810 Adapterdrivers for Linux before version 1.0.4 may allow an authenticated user topotentially enable denial of service via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1009-oem - 5.13.0-1009.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.14.0-1004-oem - 5.14.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1007-intel - 5.13.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-21-generic - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-5.13.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-21-generic - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-21-generic-64k - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-21-lowlatency - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-1008-aws - 5.13.0-1008.9~20.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1011-oracle - 5.13.0-1011.13~20.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1008-gcp - 5.13.0-1008.9~20.04.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1009-azure - 5.13.0-1009.10~20.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1003-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1003.5~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1007.8~20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-raspi').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-aws-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.11, was needed').
linux-azure-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.11, was needed').
linux-gcp-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.11, was needed').
linux-oracle-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.11, was needed').
linux-bluefield package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.11: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.13, was needed').
linux-oem-5.13 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-1009.10').
linux-aws-5.11: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.13, was needed').
